details.top: 'Aaishah (radhi-yAllaahu 'Anhaa) narrated that the Messenger of Allaah (sal-Allaahu 'alayhe wa sallam) used to say at night if he turned during sleep:
details.arabic_diacless: لا إلٰه إلا اللٰه الواحد القهار، رب السموات والأرض وما بينهما العزيز الغفار
details.arabic: لَا إِلٰهَ إِلَّا اللّٰهُ الْوَاحِدُ الْقَهَّارُ، رَبُّ السَّمَوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا الْعَزِيْزُ الْغَفَّارُ
details.transliteration: Laa 'ilaaha 'illallaahul-Waahidul-Qahhaaru, Rabbus-samaawaati wal'ardhi wa maa baynahumal-'Azeezul-Ghaffaaru.
details.translations: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, the One, the Victorious, Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the All-Forgiving.
details.reference: Sahih by Hakim. Imam Dhahabi 1/540; Nasai, Amalul Yaomi Wallayla No. 202, Ibnus sunni No. 757. Also see, Sahih Jame 4:213

pageTitle: When turning over during the night
